thread.title: Statistics on traffic accidents high for teen drivers
thread.title_full: Statistics on traffic accidents high for teen drivers

author: 13abc
title: Statistics on traffic accidents high for teen drivers
text:
BOWLING GREEN, Ohio (13abc Action News) - Teen drivers continue to cause a disproportionate number of traffic crashes each year. As National Teen Driving Safety Week is October 18-24, it’s the perfect time for teens and their parents to discuss the dangers new drivers face so they can make safe and responsible decisions.
Young drivers between 15 and 19 years old were involved in nearly 15% (128,349) of all traffic crashes from 2012-2014. Of those crashes, a teen driver was at-fault 73% of the time. These crashes resulted in 282 fatalities and 41,311 injuries.
While the causes of those crashes may vary, speed-related factors contributed to 59% of crashes caused by teens. Another 20% of crashes were caused by failure to yield, running a red light or running a stop sign.
“Teen drivers need to realize that poor decisions while driving now can stay with them for the rest of their lives,” said Lieutenant Jerrod A. Savidge Bowling Green Post Commander. “That is why responsibility, awareness and safety are so important for our youngest drivers.”
While education and awareness are extremely important, the Patrol also wants to change driver behavior through traffic enforcement.
Teen drivers are encouraged to plan ahead when traveling to eliminate rushing to their destination. They are also reminded that safety belts save lives and they should encourage everyone in their vehicle to buckle up, every time.
